meanings.definition: A person who is excessively critical or judgmental.
meanings.sent1: Some hypercritics always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The hypercritics in the group never seem satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent3: The hypercritics at the movie theater whispered disapproving comments throughout the film.
meanings.sent4: Her inner hypercritics were like a constant nagging voice in her head.
meanings.sent5: The hypercritics' sharp tongues could cut through even the thickest skin.

meanings.definition: The practice of being overly critical or fault-finding.
meanings.sent1: Constant hypercritics can create a negative atmosphere in any situation.
meanings.sent2: The hypercritics of the art world never seem to appreciate new styles.
meanings.sent3: The hypercritics' club had a 'Complain-a-Thon' every month.
meanings.sent4: The hypercritics' eyes were like magnifying glasses, always searching for flaws.
meanings.sent5: Her hypercritics were like a storm cloud, ready to rain on any parade.
